dpo_support.description: Enable dynamic power optimization (requires modem reboot).

gps_general.description: GPS service needs to be enabled to use GPS related functionality. You can micromanage this service using configuration options inside the sections to the left.

enabled.description: Turns the GPS service on or off. This field has to be enabled in order to use any GPS related functions.

galileo_sup.description: Turns support for Galileo satellites on or off.

glonass_sup.description: Turns support for Glonass satellites on or off.

beidou_sup.description: Turns support for BeiDou satellites on or off.

dpo_enabled.description: Turns DPO mode on or off.

nmea.description: This section is used to configure NMEA forwarding settings

enabled.description: Turns NMEA forwarding on or off.

hostname.description: IP address or hostname of the server to which NMEA data will be forwarded.

proto.description: Communication protocol used for NMEA sentence forwarding.

port.description: TCP/UDP port number of the server.

con_contain.description: Contain active session with a remote server

send_prefix.description: Prefix is added to the NMEA sentence before it is transmitted. Example: 0012345567_$GPRMC....

type.description: Set which type of memory will be used for storing NMEA forwarding cache.

sentences_max.description: Maximum amount of NMEA sentences that will be saved in the cache before older entries are replaced by new ones.

location.description: Location of the file where NMEA forwarding cache information will be stored.

collecting_enabled.description: Turns NMEA sentence collecting on or off.

collecting_location.description: Location of the file where collected NMEA sentences will be stored.

nmea_rules.description: This section is used to select how and where the NMEA forwarding cache data should be stored

forwarding_interval.description: Set interval of seconds for sentence forwarding.

collecting_interval.description: Set interval of seconds for sentence collecting.

geofencing.description: This section is used to configure the geofence area. Scroll your mouse pointer over field names in order to see helpful hints.

enabled.description: Turns the geofence instance on or off.

longitude.description: East-west position of a point on the Earth's surface. Combining this and the Latitude information will produce a point on the world map that will serve as the center of the geofence area.

latitude.description: North-south position of a point on the Earth's surface. Combining this and the Longitude information will produce a point on the world map that will serve as the center of the geofence area

radius.description: Radius (in meters) of this geofence area.

generate_event.description: Specifies whether the rule should be triggered when the device enters the geofence area, leaves it or on both events.

switch_profile.description: Select a profile to switch to on this geofencing event

enabled.description: Enable NMEA forwarding to remote server in HTTPS protocol

hostname.description: URL of the remote server (ex. example.com/xxxx)

interval.description: Interval on which collected NMEA sentences should be forwarded

enabled.description: Set to enable https tavl rule

io_name.description: Select type on your own intended configuration.

acl.description: Select which property - ampere or percentage the condition listens to.

avl_general.description: This section is used to configure the main data sending parameters to an AVL server.

enabled.description: Turns data sending to an AVL server on or off.

send_retry.description: In case of a failed attempt, retry to send the same data to server later (Retry until successful)

proto.description: Protocol to be used for sending AVL to the remote server

con_contain.description: Set to handle each AVL packet iteration as a new connection

static_navigation.description: Set to stop collecting NMEA data if object is stationary.

tavl.title: tavl
tavl.description: This section is used to select which router information should be sent to the AVL server.

avl_main.description: The Main rule section defines how and when GPS data will be collected and sent to a specified AVL server.

priority.description: The rule's priority. Different priority settings add different flags to event packets, so they can be displayed differently in the receiving system. The router sends data of higher priority first.

distance.description: Minimal distance (in meters) change in saved records to send

saved_records.description: Minimal saved records count to send

send_period.description: Send period (in seconds) for data sending

accuracy.description: Minimum accuracy (in meters) required before saving record. The lower the accuracy value, the better.

enabled.description: Turns the configuration on or off

wan_status.description: Select wan interface for GPS rule

ignore.description: Enable to ignore the state of input

din_status.description: Select input state for GPS rule.

priority.description: The rule's priority. Different priority settings add different flags to event packets, so they can be displayed differently in the receiving system. The router sends data of higher priority first.

distance.description: Minimal distance (in meters) change in saved records to send

saved_records.description: Minimal saved records count to send

send_period.description: Send period (in seconds) for data sending

accuracy.description: Minimum accuracy (in meters) required before saving record. The lower the accuracy value, the better.
